newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia's Maxis sees reaching '96 subscriber goal.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia's Maxis sees reaching '96 subscriber goal.

text.p: Binariang Sdn Bhd cellular phone unit Maxis Mobile said it expected to achieve its target of 135,000 subscribers by December 31, 1996.
The digital cellular network operator said in a statement on Monday that it currently has 115,000 customers. It had earlier targeted 95,000 customers by the end of 1996.
"We achieved our previous target about three months ahead of schedule," Binariang executive director for marketing and sales C.Y. Chin said in the statement.
He said the company is optimistic it will meet its new target for subscribers by the end of 1996 in view of the "unprecedented growth" in its subscriber base.
Binariang is a joint venture between Malaysian shareholders, including company head Ananda Krishnan, who own 80 percent of the equity, with 20 percent held by U S West Communications.
